Name: Aloo gobi
Description: Cauliflower with potatoes sautéed with garam masala, turmeric, sometimes kalonji and curry leaves.

Name: Aloo tikki
Description: Patties of potato mixed with some vegetables fried

Name: Aloo matar
Description: Potatoes and peas in curry

Name: Aloo methi
Description: Potato with fresh Methi leaves.

Name: Aloo shimla mirch
Description: Green capsicum with potatoes sautéed with cumin seeds, onions, tomatoes, ginger-garlic paste, turmeric, red chilli powder and garam masala

Name: Amriti with rabdi
Description: a dessert made by combining amriti with rabdi

Name: Amritsari fish
Description: Fried fish made with curry, ginger, and garlic

Name: Amritsari kulcha
Description: mildly leavened flatbread

Name: Baati
Description: hard, unleavened bread cooked in most of areas of Rajasthan, and in some parts of Madhya Pradesh, and Gujarat states of India.

Name: Bhatura
Description: a fluffy deep-fried leavened bread originating from the Indian subcontinent.

Name: Bhindi masala
Description: Okra sautéed with onions and tomatoes

Name: Biryani
Description: Mixed rice dish, optional spices, optional vegetables, meats or seafood. Can be served with plain yogurt.

Name: Butter chicken
Description: dish, originating in the Indian subcontinent, of chicken in a mildly spiced tomato sauce. It is also known as murgh mahal

Name: Chaat
Description: Street food. Usually containing potato patty fried in oil, topped with sweet yogurt, and other sauces and spices

Name: Chana masala
Description: Chickpeas of the Chana type in tomato based sauce.

Name: Chapati
Description: unleavened flatbread originating from the Indian subcontinent and staple in India, Nepal, Bangladesh, Pakistan, Sri Lanka, East Africa and the Caribbean.

Name: Chicken razala
Description: a Bhopali style chicken cooked in a rich gravy with mint

Name: Chicken Tikka
Description: Chicken with spices served on a skewer

Name: Chicken Tikka masala
Description: Chicken marinated in a Yogurt tomato sauce. It is known to have a creamy texture.

Name: Chole bhature
Description: Main course with Chick peas, assorted spices, wheat flour and bhatura yeast.

Name: Daal baati churma
Description: a Rajasthani specialty

Name: Daal puri
Description: Stuffed dal in parathas

Name: Dal makhani (kali dal)
Description: a main course with lentils

Name: Dal
Description: Assorted types of lentils, such as toor, urad, chana, masoor dal

Name: Dal fry with tadka
Description: Typical north Indian tadka

Name: Dum aloo
Description: Potatoes cooked in curry

Name: Poha
Description: Specialty from Madhya Pradesh. Common snack in central part of India. Flattended rice, potato, turmeric.

Name: Fara
Description: Stuffed Lentil Dumplings

Name: Firni
Description: This is a dessert made of fine flour and ghee that is made only in Pundri.

Name: French bean aloo
Description: Diced French beans with potatoes cooked with chopped onions, tomatoes sautéed with cumin seeds, green chillies and garam masala

Name: Gajar ka halwa
Description: sweet dish native to U.P. / Punjab. Carrot, Milk, Ghee, Cashew.

Name: Gajar matar aloo
Description: Diced red/orange carrots and potatoes sautéed with black mustard leaves, garnished with ground black pepper powder and lemon juice

Name: Gobhi matar
Description: Cauliflower in a tomato sauce

Name: Imarti
Description: spherically meshed sweet dish from North India made up of batter from moong dal dipped in sugary syrup

Name: Hari mutter ka nimona (green peas daal)
Description: a Typical north Indian tadka

Name: Jalebi
Description: A North Indian twisted noodle like sweet dish dipped in sugary syrup

Name: Jaleba
Description: A bigger form of jalebi

Name: Kachori
Description: Rajasthani / Marwari special

Name: Kadai paneer
Description: Paneer and green peppers in tomato gravy

Name: Kadhi pakoda
Description: Gram flour with yogurt with gramflour fried balls

Name: Karela bharta
Description: a bitter gourd or melon dish

Name: Katha meetha petha / halwakadoo
Description: Pumpkin cooked in spices

Name: Kheer
Description: Rice cooked with milk and dry fruits

Name: Khichdi
Description: Rice cooked with daal and veggies and sauteed

Name: Kofta
Description: Gram flour balls fried with vegetables. Gram flour, veggies, rolled into balls with gram flour and fried in oil and then cooked with curry.

Name: Kulfi falooda
Description: dessert to ward off sweltering heat of summers

Name: Lauki ke kofte
Description: a way to serve bottle gourd

Name: Lauki ki subji
Description: a way to serve bottle gourd

Name: Litti chokha
Description: a baked salted wheat flour cake filled with sattu (baked chickpea flour) and some special spices

Name: Makki di roti, sarson da saag
Description: Creamed sarson mustard leaves, with heavily buttered roti made from corn flour.  Punjabi winter favorite.

Name: Mathura ke pede
Description: a sort of a confection

Name: Methi saag, chaulai saab
Description: Veggie leaves sauteed in oil and garlic with little masalas. Cooked mostly in central part of India.

Name: Misi roti
Description: Whole wheat & gram flour dough ground masalas, pan fried

Name: Mixed vegetable
Description: mixed vegetables, slow cooked with a tomato sauce added.

Name: Moong dal ka halwa
Description: a dish made with yellow lentils, milk, sugar, and nuts

Name: Mushroom do pyaza
Description: Mushrooms & Onions in a tomato masala sauce spiced with chilles

Name: Mushroom matar
Description: Mushrooms and sweet peas in a masala or chili sauce

Name: Naan
Description: Tandoor-baked soft flatbread made with refined wheat flour.

Name: Navrattan korma
Description: Vegetables, Nuts, Paneer Cheese in a tomato cream sauce

Name: Pakhala
Description: Cooked rice with water

Name: Palak paneer
Description: Paneer cubes in spinach gravy

Name: Paneer butter masala
Description: Paneer made with Indian Cheese. Paneer is substituted for meat in Vegetarian dishes

Name: Paneer tikka masala
Description: vegetarian alternative to chicken tikka masala

Name: Pani puri
Description: a typical Indian tadka

Name: Panjeeri
Description: a mixture of butter, dried fruits and whole wheat flour served as a dessert.

Name: Papad
Description: A crispy add on to Lunch and Dinner, for adding a spicy and crunchier taste to food.

Name: Paratha
Description: flatbread native to the Indian subcontinent, prevalent throughout the modern-day nations of India, Sri Lanka, Pakistan, Nepal, Bangladesh, Maldives, and Myanmar, where wheat is the traditional staple

Name: Pattor
Description: A flour based snack

Name: Phirni
Description: a rice Pudding

Name: Pindi chana
Description: a chickpea dish

Name: Pinni
Description: An almond based dessert

Name: Rajma chaval
Description: a bean curry with rice

Name: Rajma
Description: Main. Kidney beans & assorted spices.

Name: Ramatori subji
Description: a spicy side dish made with any two vegetables i.e. potatoes and cabbage

Name: Rongi
Description: Black eyes peas, onions and tomatoes in a curry sauce

Name: Samosa
Description: Normally served as an entree or appetiser. Potatoes, onions, peas, coriander, and lentils, may be served with a mint or tamarind sauce

Name: Samose
Description: a typical north Indian tadka

Name: Sattu ki roti
Description: a dish from Bihar

Name: Shahi paneer
Description: A popular Indian, as well as Punjabi and Nepalese dish, made with paneer in a thick cream and tomato gravy and spices

Name: Shahi tukra
Description: a bread pudding in a rich sauce of thickened milk, garnished with sliced almonds

Name: Singhada halwa
Description: Lotus fruit dried and powdered to make this fasting sweet meat

Name: Sooji halwa
Description: Semolina cooked with clarified butter and dry fruits. Semolina (Suji), clarified butter, cashew nuts.

Name: Sweet pethas / kesar petha / pista petha
Description: A ravioli like dessert stuffed with a choice of fillings and equally popular in various parts of India and Pakistan

Name: Vegetable jalfrezi
Description: Meat and spices fried in a pan. Can be vegetarian as well.

Name: Tandoori Chicken
Description: Tandoori chicken as a dish originated in the Punjab before the independence of India and Pakistan.

Name: Tandoori Fish Tikka
Description: Fish marinated in lime and ginger and cooked over an open fire.
